subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Book suggestions for translation.
msgSnippet: I think that is a very good selection for translation.  But, I wonder, will it be in Quikscript and easy to access?  I have no idea where to find any
messageBody:
I think that is a very good selection for translation.  But, I wonder, will it be in Quikscript and easy to access?  I have no idea where to find any quikscript on internet.  Also, I wonder if there is any way to read the quikscript written by different people.  I know the junior script and most of the senior script.  Will I be able to read those scripts?
Sid

--- On Sun, 7/31/11, peter_r_guinness <bacedif@...> wrote:

From: peter_r_guinness <bacedif@...>
Subject: [Read_Alphabet] Re: Book suggestions for translation.
To: Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com
Date: Sunday, July 31, 2011, 4:30 AM

 



--- In Read_Alphabet@yahoogroups.com, "peter_r_guinness" <bacedif@...> wrote:
>
> I'm thinking about translating another book to QS for use as beginner's practise reading material.
>
> .....

Ok, so I've decided that I shall translate "The Wizard Of Oz". I will use international spellings according to my old proposal- see files:/International Quikscript/Malt's International Quikscript Project. I will use the Thoth_Int* font and consult the Longman's Pronunciation Dictionary for spellings that I'm uncertain of. It hope it will only take 4-6 weeks.

*Thoth_Int is just Thoth font which I extended with additional characters and remapped to different keys
